title: William Shakespeare - 21 - John Gielgud 1948
description:
If thou didst ever hold me in thy heart
Absent thee from felicity a while,
And in this harsh world draw thy breath in pain
To tell my story....


The critical consensus is that Gielgudâ€™s Hamlet was one of the most distinguished of the twentieth century... â€˜utterly compelling, crystal clear, totally absorbing, with a classic quality that reflects the utter rightness of the interpretationâ€™.

This is the bbc radio 3 production made in 1948 (the same year Olivier made his film of Hamlet), now re-issued by Naxos. (Go to Naxos Spoken Word Library for other classic titles) Kindly seed
